data.title: Fixes bug that selection voices are played twice when selecting groups
data.body:
…via 0-9 hotkeys.

Problem was that the voice was played for both KeyUp and KeyDown events.

Closes #8121.
Split from #8012.

data.title: Prevents actors under active Gap Gen from being auto-targeted.
data.body: Depends on #8202. This patch makes units/buildings under active gap generator not auto targetable.

data.title: Reverts #8097.
data.body: #8097 fixed location of cloaked units being revealed by attack line but caused enemies under fog not being targeted even with satellite. See #8190 for further discussion.

data.title: Fixed Tiberian Sun multiplayer spawn and waypoints
data.body:
I redid them based on `blank01.tem`:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756669/7734355/bdf42918-ff35-11e4-9611-b943d0a3a263.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756669/7734358/c25c0f48-ff35-11e4-8a4e-28d7cc01f29e.png)

as the ones copied from RA1 were in the wrong shape, tilesize and palette which undid the transparency effect as depicted in http://www.ppmforums.com/viewtopic.php?p=530427#530427.

data.title: Sheet fixes
data.body:
Fixes #8197 (disclaimer: untested).

The voxel renderer creates unbuffered sheets but still allocates sprites over them. This unusual use case caused the sheet builder to fall over as it always assumed buffered sheets would be created and thus need releasing.

Ultimately, releasing the buffer if the sheet is unbuffered is not a problem. You only need to get the exception when calling CommitData as that assumes you were writing to the buffer and now want that buffer committed to texture. If you try and commit and there was no buffer, that's a logic error you want to know about.
- If you call ReleaseBuffer and the buffer is already released, this now is a no-op rather than an exception.
- I have renamed CommitData to CommitBufferedData for a bit of extra clarity. This remains an exception if called when there is no buffer.
- The junk code doing some thread-safety in Sheet has been removed. It is not needed as the only cross-thread call was removed in #8103 because the thread-safety was half-baked anyway.

data.title: added mission 6b nod
data.body:
So here is the second mission of level 6.
I think I adopt all the point of mission 6a.

In this mission I did not add a secondary object, but I can if requested.

data.title: Unbuffered sheet exception in voxel renderer
data.body:
Reported by @GraionDilach in IRC. Pinging @RoosterDragon.

```
Attacque Superior Mod at Version {DEV_VERSION}
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.18444
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: This sheet is unbuffered. You cannot call CommitData on an unbuffered sheet. If you need to completely replace the texture data you should set data into the texture directly. If you need to make only small changes to the texture data consider creating a buffered sheet instead.
   at OpenRA.Graphics.Sheet.CommitData(Boolean releaseBuffer) in e:\OpenRA-dev\OpenRA.Game\Graphics\Sheet.cs:line 171
   at OpenRA.Graphics.Sheet.ReleaseBuffer() in e:\OpenRA-dev\OpenRA.Game\Graphics\Sheet.cs:line 163
   at OpenRA.Graphics.SheetBuilder.Allocate(Size imageSize, float2 spriteOffset) in e:\OpenRA-dev\OpenRA.Game\Graphics\SheetBuilder.cs:line 120
   at OpenRA.Graphics.VoxelRenderer.RenderAsync(WorldRenderer wr, IEnumerable`1 voxels, WRot camera, Single scale, Single[] groundNormal, WRot lightSource, Single[] lightAmbientColor, Single[] lightDiffuseColor, PaletteReference color, PaletteReference normals, PaletteReference shadowPalette) in e:\OpenRA-dev\OpenRA.Game\Graphics\VoxelRenderer.cs:line 164
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Graphics.VoxelRenderable.FinalizedVoxelRenderable..ctor(WorldRenderer wr, VoxelRenderable voxel)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Graphics.VoxelRenderable.PrepareRender(WorldRenderer wr)
   at OpenRA.Graphics.WorldRenderer.<GenerateRenderables>b__6(IRenderable r) in e:\OpenRA-dev\OpenRA.Game\Graphics\WorldRenderer.cs:line 118
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.WhereSelectEnumerableIterator`2.MoveNext()
   at System.Collections.Generic.List`1..ctor(IEnumerable`1 collection)
   at System.Linq.Enumerable.ToList[TSource](IEnumerable`1 source)
   at OpenRA.Graphics.WorldRenderer.GenerateRenderables() in e:\OpenRA-dev\OpenRA.Game\Graphics\WorldRenderer.cs:line 117
   at OpenRA.Graphics.WorldRenderer.Draw() in e:\OpenRA-dev\OpenRA.Game\Graphics\WorldRenderer.cs:line 131
   at OpenRA.Game.RenderTick() in e:\OpenRA-dev\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:line 501
   at OpenRA.Game.Loop() in e:\OpenRA-dev\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:line 623
   at OpenRA.Game.Run() in e:\OpenRA-dev\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:line 641
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args) in e:\OpenRA-dev\OpenRA.Game\Support\Program.cs:line 111
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args) in e:\OpenRA-dev\OpenRA.Game\Support\Program.cs:line 39
```

data.title: Fixed StyleCop on Mono 4
data.body:
Fixes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/8015.

We need MSBuild in the .NET Framework 3.5 version. Mono 4 dropped those so we need to manually install them as a dependency now. I consider this a workaround until we replace this with something modern probably https://github.com/dotnet/roslyn based in the future.

data.title: Fix revealing fakes by double-clicking a building
data.body: Fixes #8181

data.title: Ingame map editor crashes when loading modded maps that fail YAML check.
data.body: They would normally just be "not compatible with this version OpenRA".

data.title: Improve performance of line rendering
data.body:
- Create an overload that renders a line in one colour, as this allows most existing calls to be simplified. This also allows a slight performance improvement by only normalizing the components once.
- Introduce a DrawLineStrip method. This improves performance by allowing the colour components to be normalized once for the whole strip, and only needing to calculate vertices once per point rather than twice since we can reuse the last result.

This reduces the CPU time spent rendering the lines of the perf graph widget on the RA shellmap from 4.7% to 2.6%.

data.title: Added a German translation for the Linux desktop entry
data.body: This is exposed in KDE.

data.title: Add a custom text display to lua
data.body: Also exposed the color to lua. The problem here: HSLColor defaults to black. So I created a workaround [here at `Media.DisplayMessage`](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8191/files#diff-0612b1f741b8612131b70560bfabc77aR172). What to do about that and should this "workaround" also apply to the other methods that default to black now?

data.title: Adds a new IFogCoverHandler interface.
data.body: This makes it possible to distinguish cloaked units. Also fixes a bug introduced by #8097 where units wouldn't fire at enemies under fog even with fog visibility. Because hidden under fog and cloak were using the same IVisibilityModifier interface.

Seems to be okay in the SNOW theatre

data.title: TS - Ingame map editor lets us place SNOW tiles in the TEMPERAT theatre
data.body: Check out the Misc Buildings, Clear tabs, etc. This isn't the case the other way around.

data.title: Brought back the Windows setup deployment via Travis CI
data.body:
Closes #8153
- Travis CI will do the final Windows deployment so every official release CLI get's compiled by the same compiler using the same flags to avoid possible desyncs.
- We switch back the legacy Travis CI non-Docker environment, because we need sudo to install NSIS. ~~The nuget connectivity problems should be gone now thanks to caching.~~ Caching is not supported on the non-container based infrastructure. :(
- I decided to still keep the AppVeyor Setup creation so we keep our nightly builds and CI checks for the NSIS scripts which tend to bit rot faster, because everything has to be listed and the syntax is error prone.

data.title: Added raycaster and fixed neutrino bullets. Take two!
data.body: I'm not sure if the intersection code is necessary.

data.title: Inheriting DefaultVariant does not work in voices.yaml
data.body:
``` yaml
    ^DefaultVoice:
    Voices:
        Burned: dm01
        Zapped: igenzapa
    Variants: .WAV
    DefaultVariant: .wav

    SovietMCVVoice:
    Inherits: ^DefaultVoice
    Voices:
        Select: vmcssea, vmcsseb, vmcssec, vmcssed, vmcssee
        Move: vmcsmoa, vmcsmob, vmcsmoc, vmcsmod, vmcsmoe
        Attack: vmcsmoa, vmcsmob, vmcsmoc, vmcsmod, vmcsmoe`
```

used in voices.yaml results with

```
Attempt to Play2D a null `ISoundSource`
LoadSound, file does not exist: vmcssed.aud
Attempt to Play2D a null `ISoundSource`
LoadSound, file does not exist: vmcssec.aud
```

messages.

I don't think that's supposed to happen. The wavs are loose and bits reference lists their folder.

data.title: AttackMove is broken for some unit types with "Defend" stance
data.body:
While working on https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/compare/bleed...obrakmann:default-stance-defend I noticed that AttackMove is broken for E3s when their stance is set to "Defend" (in ra at least, didn't test the other mods or other units yet). They acquire a target, but aren't close enough to fire and won't move in range. E1s don't seem to have that problem.

![screenshot from 2015-05-17 20 34 06](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4331210/7671571/c15d7fb6-fcd6-11e4-96b3-89d543922590.png)
![screenshot from 2015-05-17 20 31 43](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4331210/7671570/c15d77b4-fcd6-11e4-98c3-3d3ee9475ecb.png)

I can reproduce this in release-20141029, so it's not really a recent bug.

data.title: Fixed the build for Mono 2.10 again
data.body: Fedora failed at https://build.opensuse.org/package/show/games:openra/development

data.title: make.cmd gives error if check is run before all
data.body: If check is run before the project is compiled, make.cmd shows error. It could instead compile automatically if the binaries don't exist, or ask to compile.

data.title: France, reveal fake buildings easily!
data.body:
If you double click (to highlight all of same type) on a fake building, it won't also highlight the real one revealing it to enemies easily. Works the other way around too, double click real building doesn't highlight fake ones.

Found by me, confirmed by Penev.

data.title: windows: build system should check for existence of Visual C++ 2010 redistributable
data.body:
during my attempts to build openra the resulting build would crash on startup with a misleading error about freetype not being installed, but worked after some help from #openra and installing the Visual C++ 2010 redistributable

it would make sense to warn/error during the build (either by 'make all' or 'make dependencies') if VC2010 is not installed on a system
